subject: RE: [junit] Re: JUnit 4 restructuring
msgSnippet: ... Yeah, I agree that it does sound right, and for the same reason that I ve always thought the order of arguments for all the other assert* methods is
messageBody:
> Good point. There is a reason. Read this out loud, and you
> might see why the flip feels right:
>
> assertThat(x, isLessThan(5));

Yeah, I agree that it does sound right, and for the same
reason that I've always thought the order of arguments
for all the other assert* methods is backwards.

I always read...

assertEquals("blue", sky.color());

...as, "assert blue the sky's color is".

That's great for Yoda, but my human brain thinks
"assert that the color of the sky is blue" is more
natural. So, I'm often tempted to write...

assertEquals(sky.color(), "blue");

But that's wrong.


Todd.
